name: Number of clients initiated on ART during the reporting period
numerator: Number of clients initiated on ART
numeratorFormula: Count of clients with ART start date in reporting period
definition: This indicator measures the total number of clients who started antiretroviral therapy (ART) for the first time during the reporting period. Includes all age groups and risk populations.
useContext: Used to monitor HIV treatment program expansion and uptake. Essential for tracking progress toward UNAIDS 95-95-95 targets. Report monthly at facility level, aggregate quarterly at district level.

name: Number of clients currently on ART at the end of the reporting period
numerator: Number of clients currently receiving ART
numeratorFormula: Count of active clients on ART at end of period
definition: This indicator counts all clients who are actively receiving antiretroviral therapy at the end of the reporting period. Excludes clients who have died, transferred out, or defaulted from treatment.
useContext: Critical indicator for measuring treatment coverage and retention. Used for national and international reporting including WHO Global AIDS Monitoring. Report monthly.

name: Viral load suppression rate among clients on ART for 12+ months
numerator: Number of clients with suppressed viral load (<1000 copies/ml)
numeratorFormula: Count of clients with VL result <1000 copies/ml
denominator: Number of clients on ART for 12+ months with VL result
denominatorFormula: Count of clients on ART ≥12 months with VL test in reporting period
definition: Percentage of clients on ART for at least 12 months who have achieved viral suppression, defined as viral load <1000 copies/ml. Based on most recent viral load test result in the reporting period.
useContext: Key quality indicator for ART program effectiveness. Monitors progress toward third 95 target (95% virally suppressed). Report quarterly. Target: ≥95% suppression rate.

name: Number of TB cases diagnosed and initiated on treatment
numerator: Number of TB cases started on treatment
numeratorFormula: Count of patients diagnosed with TB and started on treatment regimen
definition: Total number of new and relapse tuberculosis cases that were diagnosed and initiated on first-line TB treatment during the reporting period. Includes all forms of TB (pulmonary and extrapulmonary).
useContext: Essential for TB program monitoring and case detection surveillance. Report quarterly. Disaggregate by HIV status, age group, and TB type (new/relapse, DR-TB).

name: Number of pregnant women initiated on ART during the reporting period
numerator: Number of pregnant women initiated on ART
numeratorFormula: Count of pregnant women with ART start date in reporting period
definition: Number of HIV-positive pregnant women who started antiretroviral therapy for the first time during their pregnancy in the reporting period. Includes women identified through PMTCT services.
useContext: Critical for prevention of mother-to-child transmission (PMTCT) program monitoring. Report monthly. Essential for tracking progress toward elimination of vertical transmission.

name: Number of emergency medical service responses within target time
numerator: Number of EMS responses within target time
numeratorFormula: Count of responses with arrival time ≤ target for priority level
denominatorFormula: Count of all EMS emergency responses
definition: Percentage of emergency medical service responses that arrived at the scene within the target response time based on call priority level. Priority 1: 15 min, Priority 2: 40 min, Priority 3: 120 min.
useContext: Quality indicator for emergency medical services. Report monthly. Used to monitor EMS system performance and identify areas requiring resource allocation improvements.

name: Retention on ART at 12 months
numerator: Number of clients retained on ART at 12 months
numeratorFormula: Count of clients still on ART 12 months after initiation
denominator: Number of clients initiated on ART 12 months ago
denominatorFormula: Count of clients with ART start date 12 months prior to reporting period end
definition: Percentage of clients who initiated ART 12 months prior to the reporting period end date who are still alive and on treatment. Excludes documented transfers to other facilities.
useContext: Key retention indicator for ART program quality. Report quarterly. Cohort-based calculation. Target: ≥90% retention at 12 months.

name: Number of community-based HIV tests conducted
numerator: Number of HIV tests performed in community settings
numeratorFormula: Count of HIV tests conducted outside health facilities
definition: Total number of HIV tests conducted in community settings including mobile clinics, outreach programs, and community testing campaigns. Excludes facility-based testing.
useContext: Monitors reach and coverage of community-based HIV testing services. Report monthly. Essential for tracking case-finding strategies beyond facility-based services.

name: TB treatment success rate
numerator: Number of TB cases with successful treatment outcome
numeratorFormula: Count of TB cases cured or treatment completed
denominator: Number of TB cases registered for treatment in cohort
denominatorFormula: Count of all TB cases registered in treatment cohort
definition: Percentage of TB cases that successfully completed treatment (cured or completed) out of all cases registered in the treatment cohort. Based on standard WHO outcome definitions.
useContext: Core TB program quality indicator. Report quarterly for cohorts completing treatment. WHO target: ≥90% treatment success rate. Disaggregate by HIV status and drug resistance.

name: Number of male circumcisions performed for HIV prevention
numerator: Number of voluntary medical male circumcisions performed
definition: Total number of voluntary medical male circumcisions (VMMC) performed as part of HIV prevention services. Includes all age groups targeted for VMMC services (typically 10-49 years).
useContext: Prevention indicator for HIV biomedical intervention. Report monthly. Used to track progress toward VMMC coverage targets in priority districts. Disaggregate by age group.
